column5: I know Lake simcoe has a site, but does anyone know any sites where it gives you good ice conditions? I know it won't have all the lakes available so is thier something that tells you the average in the city? Don't know if that makes sense Lol

According to the Simcoe Board posts there are already a few looking to test their floater suits & cold water swimming abilities! Apparently they're on 3" to 4" of ice . . . . .    wait till they get a stiff offshore breeze . . . . .     !
Check out ice fishing site its pretty good.

Well my foot got wet playin pond hockey this weekend. Luckily the pond i play on is more of a whats his name and well, you couldnt really "fall through" if you tried.  Moral of the story?  Its not ice fishing time yet!
check out http://www.kawarthalakesimcoefishing.com/ mostly simcoe, but includes others.

Oh no, not yet guys. Just planning a trip ahead in about 3 weeks or so. The place I have had my mind in site is getting about on average -15 temps everyday for about the past 2 weeks, but I still would like to be sure that the lake is frozen when I egt thier. And safe since I don't wear a floater suite. Ice fishing right now is out of the question. Just in the planning stge. And Thanks for the links guys
-15 during the day, for 2 weeks, you have no worries.
I was out this past weekend on a lake near my house, and there was 5" of ice plenty to walk out on. I also caught a few fish too.

Different location, but last Thursday, I saw a guy on a quad, pulling an ice hut across Weller Bay in Trenton. Thought he was a little nuts, but he seemed to know where he was going! Didn't see a splash as he tore off, out of site! HH
